intro: Achyronia hystrix, commonly known as the spiked achyronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple. Its leaves are ovate with prominent veins and are covered in fine hairs. Achyronia hystrix is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
